reviews.text: You can easily feel the Sheraton difference just at the front gate.
reviews.title: Simply Sheraton..

reviews.text: Wery well furnished hotel, perfect business amenities, helpful staff. Even every single detail is not missed. I have stayed 1 night at the hotel and extremely enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Supremely 'Smeh'

reviews.text: One night stay in August. Sheraton West Park's biggest asset is it's breakfast spread which was quite impressive.
reviews.title: Excellent service, normal price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the whole- the rate was average, the service doubly average, the location absolutely nothing to rave about.
reviews.title: Location OK, rooms comfortable

reviews.text: Pay the extra- stay in town or alternatively pick the Westin.
reviews.title: Friendly, clean and spacious
Nice location, great breakfast
reviews.text: I stayed for 3 nights in late September, just the beginning of Octerberfest. The hotel is part of a large condominium, so you share fitness and pool (small) with the tenants. Having said that, the hotel section is quite nice, and the room is spacious. It locates near the train station and convenient for moving around. The breakfast is very good with enough selection. The concierge is nice, effective and helpful with the suggestion.

I've been in this hotel more than 5 times. I prefer the westin grand but there were no rooms for this week. While other hotels with less quality asked me for more than 200 € (hilton, Novotel,holiday inn), the price here was 130 € with breakfast. Ocktoberfest had no started yet, so I do not understand this rallye of prices in munich hotels.
reviews.title: business hotel but not in July

reviews.text: I have only had problems once, it was last summer. Crowds of people from middle east invaded the hotel, of course no problem with that, but when they do not respect the others customers, I really do have. Children with nannys run through the fllor aisles, tv at maximum volume, women met in different rooms not talking but shouting. A damn party. Horrible. I had no chance but calling security staff in the hotel and they come to next room and warn them to stop and let other customers to rest. This was at 2 AM, and I had to wake up at 6.30 with an important business meeting to attend and it is understable I needed to rest and have a clear mind.
reviews.title: Convinient business hotel

reviews.text: Apart of this problem which it is common every year during july and august, the hotel is really good, rooms are comfortable and big enough, reception has been recently refurbished, pool at the top floor is fine and staff is pleasant and always showed open to satisfy customers. metro is at 3 minutes walking distance and marienplatz at 15 min using underground. The area is a business one, at night is really quiet and of course safe (this is munich).
reviews.title: Nice view over munich

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed there for business reasons and was not disappointed. The rooms were nicely furbished and the bathroom was quite big. There was great variety at the breakfast buffet. I didn't test the wellness area.
reviews.title: Ya get what you pay for!

reviews.text: This is a basic Sheraton, the poor cousin of the Arabella Grand Sheraton opposite, which I presume is grander.
reviews.title: Good/Basic hotel, club rooms not worth it

reviews.text: That said, this is a pretty decent hotel though the exterior is quite stark and ugly.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a quiet location

likes.liked: — Clean rooms, easy access to train station
likes.disliked: — Like most hotels, they charge for everything

reviews.text: The rooms are clean with the standard amenities and have a balcony with nice views of the city.
reviews.title: Stylish!

reviews.text: We stayed in a club room which is on the top floors of the hotel and hence guarantees a great view. Other than that, I hardly think the Club product is worth the 40 Euro extra charge over the standard rooms. The breakfast is very basic and the 'club lounge' is a joke. This lounge is a tiny place with a few tables and one or two sofas. It gets full (and the food trays get empty quickly) during breakfast and you'll have to wait to get a seat or any food. In fact, we ended up having breakfast at the restaurant on the ground floor which is so much better.
reviews.title: Fair hotel in a quiet area of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They are supposed to serve free cocktails and snacks and stuff at the lounge in the evenings, but most of my stay was over a weekend and the lounge closes at 5 pm on weekends, so that's pretty much a waste.
reviews.title: An allround great stay

likes.liked: — the sauna, steambath and pool area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: booked a top secret hotel via lastminute.com which turned out to be this hotel , had a great rate room only but breakfast was extra at just over 40euros a night which we declined . Check in was very efficient and we were given a room on the 12th floor which was very nice with great views but during the evening we found out that the air conditioning was not working . In the morning ,we went to reception to see if anything could be done to be told the hotel was full and they would get someone to repair it but then she said that she would upgrade us to the club floor which is on the 22floor with even better views .The pool and spa on the top floor was really relaxing , especially after a long day spent sightseeing . We didn't eat at the hotel as the prices were expensive but there were plenty of bakeries and little cafes in the square behind the hotel and a supermarket near the tube station too which was about 5 mins away. The location was a few miles from the city centre which didn't bother us as the transport system is very efficient and an underground train took about 10 mins. Our only complaint would be the high internet charges which we didnt use and the prices of food and drink in the hotel but we would certainly use this hotel again
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel was great. Not only was it convenient to the subway system (just about a 5 minute walk to the nearest station), but it was right next to a business park that had restaurants, shops, and a grocery store. The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable. The staff spoke English very well and were very helpful. We had a small balcony on our room, which was very cool because it looked out over the city. The pool was gorgeous! Getting to swim every night might have been my favorite part of my stay!
reviews.title: Great hotel, loved it!
Sheraton??? More like a "mama & papa Hotel"
reviews.text: Virtually non-existent Sheraton Standards.
No luggage assitance upon arrival.
reviews.title: Great Choice

reviews.text: Room not ready at 14:30 but OK, since the check in time is 15:00.
reviews.title: Good and Comfortable Hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed here a couple of times and the facilities and service are good. There's fast internet access in the rooms that can be charged to the room which is very convenient and I found that for working in the room in the evening it was comfortable and spacious. The hotel is also located close to shops and restaurants so you don't need to feel tied to the hotel menu and prices.
reviews.title: Decent hotel for business trips but needs the refurbishment

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel recently on a business trip and expected a bit more from a Sheraton Hotel. Overall the service and the interaction with the staff was cordial. The room even though it it appears that it had been rennovated in the last two years and therefore seemed very modern was not very clean and looked very used. It was nice to have a room with a balcony though, which is a rare feature of business hotels in major cities in Germany.
reviews.title: Rather disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fitness center and the excercise equipment was in good condition and provided a nice view over Munich. Although I did not use it myself, the pool area appeared to be a bit antiquated and not a pleasure to spend time in.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money

reviews.text: The hotel is located in a close vicinity of a subway station which connects you to all of the major locations in Munich. There is a shopping center nearby which is useful for the needs during a business trip. However, this hotel is located in a rather remote location in Munich and it requires time to travel to the main locations by subway or taxi.
reviews.title: Would Stay somewhere else in Munich

reviews.text: This is a Sheraton with no soul. While it looks like other Sheratons the service here and the staff are terrible. They act like the guests are there to serve them rather than the other way around.
reviews.title: There are better options for business (and leisure) at this price.

reviews.text: Also beware -- this is not what is now called the Westin and used to be called the Sheraton at Arabella Park. It is a much nicer hotel and Sheraton is not making it clear on their website that they moved the name to this much less nice hotel.
reviews.title: OK for business travellers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got off to a bad start when we realised that we had booked the ArabellaSheraton Bogenhausen not the ArabellaSheraton Grand Hotel, Bogenhausen. Both hotels had the same address so the mistake was easily made. We arrived to get directed across the street to the less opulent ArabellaSheraton Bogenhausen.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, pity about the food & facilities

likes.disliked: — The food in the snack bar. The lack of a decent size pool

reviews.text: The reviews I had read on Trip Advisor was for the Grand Hotel so my expectations wre high. You need to remember this when reading my review.
reviews.title: ArabellaSheraton Bogenhausen: good value

likes.liked: — Big, modern rooms; easy U-bahn access; market out back
likes.disliked: — Not central to walking/historic part of town

reviews.title: very good
reviews.text: The reception area is adequate but not that attractive. Our room [an executive room] was very nicely decorated so no complaints here. We were on the 20th floor. We headed down to the reception to the snack bar for a quick lunch. The menu was small. No wine listed. The single waitress was run off her feet so it took some time to order. She apologied & explained that she doesn't ususlly work in that area. She was very pleasant. The food was quiet poor. My dim sum arrived without the dips. It tasted like it came out of a freezer. The turkey [we think it was turkey] in the club sandwich was tough & tasteless. Overall not a good experience. I would not recommend eating in the Snack Bar. We did not have breakfast so I can't comment on the food otherwise.
Would I stay there again, probably not as I think there are other hotels with better facilities in better locations for the same price.
reviews.title: Nice hotel though location is a bit far
Fantastic, top marks
reviews.text: The room was good!

The striking thing about this hotel is that it is actually part of a large apartment building (or maybe they converted some of the rooms into apartments I don't know). You will share the elevator with people with strollers and pets, and sometimes a bunch of teenagers off school. There were also some offices in the first 1 or 2 floors. When you look at the building from outside you will also find clothes or sheets hung on many balconies. My impression was significant apartment residents are from middle east.
reviews.title: Not typical hotel but ok experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I got on one of the higher floors was quite small, with a king sized bed on one side and a long desk on the other (to place TV and coffee maker), I basically have no space. For one person this is ok but I would say it could be tight if two people move at the same time.
reviews.title: What we were looking for; reasonably priced hotel near the U-bahn

reviews.text: The club room was ok in terms of the food and beverage selections. I checked the pool area and it was not crowded, but did have more people than I expected (not sure if the residents here access too, but I usually don't find that many people in a business hotel pool during daytime).
reviews.title: Nice stay- great Indian food near by!

reviews.text: The U-Bahn entrance is within 5min walk and the small plaza there also has a relatively large supermarket. A Westin hotel is right across the street from this one.
reviews.title: sauna on the roof 24h, nice view, busy
Wonderful
reviews.text: Stayed on the 21st floor. Stay was during Oktoberfest, booked 8 weeks in advance, so just grateful for a place to stay.

Stayed at the Sheraton Arabellapark. Very gud hotel. Value for money. Gud service. ver close to the train station and restaurants at a stones throw. Child friendly and very clean. If i visit Munich again I'd surely stay there again. Highly recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was exactly what I had hoped for - the staff were delightful from check in to Attila the driver who drove us to the airport on departure. The room was a little small but very well equipped and the restaurant was excellent if a little pricey. I particulaly loved the pool and spa and hugely appreciated the late opening hours which meant that it was possible to use the facility after a busy day's work. The fact the ladies only night at the Spa on Wednesdays runs from 10pm until midnight was fantastic.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel but the internet charges are outrageous

reviews.text: However - the internet charges are scandalous! the options are €6 for 30 minutes, €12 for 2 hours or €19 for 24 hours BUT once you have logged on and paid, you cannot disconnect without incurring a new charge. Therefore if you choose the 24-hour option, you cannot take your laptop to a meeting and then return. Nor as I discovered, can you restart your laptop without incurring a new charge. There was no wi-fi option within the hotel and on the upper floors, the cell phone signal was intermittent. Several other reviewers have pointed out that the internet charges were expensive - Sheraton take note - business travellers need a better service than this. Such a shame as I would use the hotel again on my forthcoming frequent business trips to Munich but this issue really put me off. I came across several other business guests also complaining about these charges. I can only suspect that this charging system has been imposed on the hotel from HQ as the staff semed embarassed when I complained but were not able to do anything. Otherwise - the hotel is superb and I wouldl reccomend it highly but if you need internet access during your stay, bring more money.....
reviews.title: Good Experience - Location could be better but overall I would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton. The location was ok. It was approx. four subway stops from the central town square. I would guess it took about 20 minutes to get to Marienplaz from the hotel. I did not eat at the hotel due to the high prices. However, I walked over to the Westin and enjoyed a couple of meals at Paulanders. It was reasonably priced around 25.00 euros. The fitness center at the hotel was nice but small. The pool, suana, etc. were very nice. Room was large for European standards and well kept.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and A+ pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are completely renewed and pretty in black and white, with wonderful and comfortable bed. They are equipped with kettle so you can make yourself a cup of tea or coffee before/after going out. The biggest plus is an awesome pool on the 22nd floor, where you can swim and look at the city lights at the same time. Sauna is also nice, although a bit small (it gets crowdy pretty fast). We didn't take the breakfast, as it is really overpriced (22 euros per person). Hotel is in the business&medical area and the U-bahn is 10-15 minutes away, 7 stops from the city centre. Ideal for younger people who don't mind a little bit of walking. Everything about the hotel was great and we will certainly come back.
reviews.title: Gave free upgrade to exec. room; ReWe supermarket near; professional staff; no free wi-fi; exorbitant phone call prices

reviews.text: We have been to Munich for 14 days and we stayed at Sheraton Arabellapark for the whole time.
reviews.title: Best value!

reviews.text: The checkin was very quick and we have been upgraded free to king size bed as our agent booked double bed, which would be a bit of a problem with a kid in between.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel

reviews.text: Room was very spacious with a lot of space to put all our luggage down and still have a lot of space to walk around in the room.
reviews.title: Overall not bad, would give 3.5 stars out of 5

reviews.text: Bathroom was also very nice with a very large shower that our daughter really enjoyed. Balcony is also accessible and has a nice view over Munich (if your room is on the right side of the hotel).
reviews.title: well appointed well rune

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are very clean, modern and well maintained with a nice large LCD TV, minibar and secure safe.
reviews.title: Excellent place, excellent location!
Okay
reviews.text: The hotel was okay. The service was not what one would expect from a Sheraton Hotel but at least the restaurant staff was really good and attentive offering magazines in English to read since I was eating alone. The rooms were dated. A non-descript hotel which was not particularly in a good location.

This was the last night of our tour and I only wish that more hotels had been like this one. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub and the wonderful view. We had dinner at the hotel and the food and service were incredible. Breakfast was the best we had on the entire trip. The buffet was everything you could think of.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is located in Arabellapark, close to the metro which takes you downtown in 4-5 minutes. The rates for this hotel are decent, however note that they still have rooms that are not renovated yet, so unless you have status with SPG, you will not get the 'club' rooms.
reviews.title: Value for Money

reviews.text: We were upgraded to a club room, but because we wanted a kitchenette we ended up in a corner suite for the payment of 70€/day extra. The service was not exactly geared for a family, even though the hotel is occupied by large families in the summer months (visitor from the gulf states who come to Munich for health care)
reviews.title: We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.text: My wife and I loved staying here because it is perfectly located in the city being just a short train ride away from the downtown of Munich, which means that it's nice and quiet at night. The breakfast each morning is awesome. We never went out for breakfast because they have everything you could possibly want. The staff was super nice and curteous, always ready to help or assist in any way possible. The rooms are cleaned very well, and the bed was the most comfortable I had ever experienced at a hotel. The clear glass wall that let's you see in to the bathroom took a bit of getting used to, but after a couple of days, my wife and I just laughed at it and thought...oh well...after all, we are in Europe. The spa was nice. It's co-ed and nudity is allowed so don't be surprised if you see some. Again...after a day or two you just get used to it. If you go during Summer months expect lots and lots of young children from Dubai to be running, rollerblading, and playing soccer on every sqaure inch of ground both in and around the hotel. I'm sure we will travel back to Munich some day, and when we do, I plan on staying at the Sheraton again.
reviews.title: Comfortable
